Package gw.cc.processes

Class RetryingBatchProcess<T extends KeyableBean>

java.lang.Object
com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.MultiPhaseBatchProcess
com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
gw.processes.BatchProcessBase
gw.cc.processes.RetryingBatchProcess<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
BatchProcess
public abstract class RetryingBatchProcess<T extends KeyableBean> extends BatchProcessBase
An abstract implementation of BatchProcess, with an added ability to retry any items that failed during execution. After the initial execution run is complete, all the failed items are then immediately retried for execution. If any of those items still fail, they are not retried further. Instead, details of these failures will be included in the OperationsFailedReasons property. NOTE: 1) This class is generified to take a parameter T, of type KeyableBean. 2) This default implementation retries a failed item only if the failure was due to a concurrent modification. All other exceptions are considered as unrecoverable failures.

  • Method Details

    • getChunkSize

      public int getChunkSize()
      The chunkSize that should be used for chunking the results of the query used for fetching items for processing. The default value would suffice in most cases. NOTE: It is *NOT* recommended to set this to zero or too high values, unless you know what you are doing!
      See Also:
      • BatchProcessBase.setChunkingById(gw.api.database.IQueryResult, int)

    • fetchItemsForProcessing

      public abstract IQueryBeanResult<T> fetchItemsForProcessing()

    • processItem

      public abstract void processItem(T item)
      Performs the actual work required to be done on each individual item. NOTE: It is guaranteed that the item will already be wrapped in a writable bundle and an active transaction, while this method is executing. Hence, implementations of this method shouldn't try to create their own transaction or to move the item to any other bundle.

    • doWork

      protected final void doWork()
      Internal method that deals with handling the BatchProcess workflow. *Not* meant to be directly invoked by child classes.
      Specified by:
      doWork in class BatchProcessBase

    • shouldRetryItem

      public boolean shouldRetryItem(Exception processingEx, T item)
      Determines if it's possible to recover from an exception that happened during the processing of a specific item. Returning true would indicate that the exception is considered recoverable and hence, the item would be queued up for a retry. NOTE: This default implementation returns true only if the failure was due to an exception caused by concurrent modification of the item. All other exceptions are considered as unrecoverable failures. Child classes can override this to provide their own logic.
      Parameters:
      processingEx - the exception that was thrown during the initial processing of the item
      item - the item that failed the processing
      Returns:
      true if the exception is considered recoverable and item should be retried, or false otherwise

    • prepareFailedItemForRetry

      public T prepareFailedItemForRetry(T item)
      This will be called to determine if an item queued up for retry is still eligible for processing. This is required, since the item might have been modified externally, and those modifications might have rendered it ineligible for processing. NOTE: This default implementation just reloads the item from the DB. Child classes can (and preferably, should) override this to provide their own logic for imposing specific eligibility requirements on the item.
      Returns:
      The object to operate on or null if the object should not be operated on

    • retryProcessing

      public void retryProcessing(T item)
      Retries processing of a specific item that had originally failed processing due to a recoverable exception. NOTE: This default implementation retries processing only once. If an item failed even during the retry, then it's considered as a permanent failure and no more retries are attempted, irrespective of whether the retry failure was due to a recoverable exception or not. Child classes can override this to implement their own retry mechanism.

    • getItemDescription

      public String getItemDescription(T item)
      Returns a human-friendly description of an item, for use by the various log statements.

    • handleUnrecoverableException

      protected void handleUnrecoverableException(T item, Exception ex)
